senses.sense_definition: A hypothetical lost parent language reconstructed by comparing similarities in its descendant languages.

examples.text: Linguists analyze modern dialects to reconstruct the vocabulary of the ancient <w>proto-language</w>.
Proto-Indo-European is a well-known <w>proto-language</w> that links many European and Asian tongues.

senses.sense_definition: The primitive communication system of sounds and gestures used by an infant before acquiring full language.

examples.text: The researcher studied how the child's <w>proto-language</w> evolved into complex sentences.
Gestures and simple sounds form a <w>proto-language</w> that helps babies communicate needs.
